question: Summarize the following email: Answer
answer: It seems the email content that needs to be summarized is missing from the provided information. Please share the full text of the email so that a concise and accurate summary can be created.
expected_answer:
For purposes of an accelerated distribution from the PSA,  a "single sum distribution," in Section 6.2 means that a PSA account is distributed all at once, as distinguished from another form of payout as may have been selected by a participant in his or her deferral agreement.
Section 6.2 is clear in that the account balance shall be determined as of the last day of the month preceding the date on which the Committee receives the written request of the Participant.

All:  Attached you will find a list that reflects your seat assignments for Business Continuity Planning (BCP).
These seats are located on the 30th and 31st Floors of Enron Center North (ECN).
As previously communicated, you will report to these designated seats in the event of an outage in ECS.
The exception to this is as follows: If your seat assignment is located on the 31st Floor, you will report to your original location that you occupied prior to your move into ECS.

question: Summarize the following email: Increased Security at Enron Center
answer: It seems the actual content of the email titled "Increased Security at Enron Center" is missing from the provided information. Without details such as the specific security measures being implemented, the reasons for the increase (e.g., recent incidents, policy updates), effective dates, or instructions for employees/visitors, I cannot generate an accurate summary. Please share the full text of the email to proceed.
expected_answer:
Late on October 25th, we received information about a nonspecific threat to the Enron Center.
We communicated with law enforcement officials who found the threat unsubstantiated and without merit.
Nonetheless we take all threats seriously and have increased the security presence at the Enron Center still further.
Once again, if you observe suspicious behavior, please call security at 3-6200.
